## R Markdown

I. Third Smallest Dice - Given seven dices that are all rolled at the same time, what value would the dice, with the third smallest number of the seven dices, hold?

```{r}
library(dplyr)                             # for functions      
library(ggplot2)                           # for data visualization  
library(fivethirtyeight)                   # data 

# Function: Rolls 7 dices to return third smallest dice
seven.dice <- function() {
  dice <- sample(1:6, size = 7, replace = TRUE)
  sort(dice, decreasing = FALSE)
  return(dice[3])
}

# Monte Carlo
face <- 1:6                                 # dice face numbers
count <- c(0,0,0,0,0,0)                     # aggregate results
set.seed(100)

for (i in 1:10000) {                        # generate random inputs
  y <- seven.dice()
  if (y == 1) {                             # deterministic computation
    
    count[1] = count[1] + 1                 
    
  } else if (y == 2) {     
    
    count[2] = count[2] + 1     
    
  } else if (y == 3) { 
    
    count[3] = count[3] + 1
    
  } else if (y == 4) {     
    
    count[4] = count[4] + 1    
    
  } else if (y == 5) {  
    
    count[5] = count[5] + 1   
    
  } else if (y == 6) {        
    
    count[6] = count[6] + 1 
  }  
}


p <- count / 10000                          # each face number probability
print(paste("Probability of", face, ":", p))

# line chart of pdf
dice_pdf <- data.frame(face,p)
ggplot(dice_pdf, aes(x=face, y=p)) + geom_line(linetype="dashed", color="blue", size= 2) + geom_point(color="red", size=3)

# line chart of cdf
p[2] = p[1] + p[2]
p[3] = p[3] + p[2]
p[4] = p[4] + p[3]
p[5] = p[5] + p[4]
p[6] = p[5] + p[6]
dice_cdf <- data.frame(face,p)
ggplot(dice_cdf, aes(x=face, y=p)) +geom_line(linetype="dashed", color="blue", size= 2) + geom_point(color="red", size=3)
```
II. Expectation

E = # of rolls / # of trials                # formula

```{r}
set.seed(2020)
rolls = NULL
for (i in 1:100000){
  f1 = FALSE
  f2 = FALSE
  f3 = FALSE
  f4 = FALSE
  f5 = FALSE
  f6 = FALSE
  count = 0
  while (!f1 || !f2 || !f3 || !f4 || !f5 || !f6){
  dice <- sample(1:6, size = 1, replace = TRUE)
  count = count + 1
  if (dice == 1){
    f1 = TRUE
  }
  if (dice == 2){
    f2 = TRUE
  }
  if (dice == 3){
    f3 = TRUE
  }
  if (dice == 4){
    f4 = TRUE
  }
  if (dice == 5){
    f5 = TRUE
  }
  if (dice == 6){
    f6 = TRUE
  }
  }
  rolls <- c(rolls, count)
}
Emc <- sum(rolls) / 100000
print(Emc)

# construct histogram
rolls_df <- data.frame(rolls)
ggplot(rolls_df, aes(x=rolls)) + geom_histogram(binwidth = 3)
```
